Package org.katpara.mathematica.linears.vectors

Class VectorOperations

java.lang.Object
org.katpara.mathematica.linears.vectors.VectorOperations
public final class VectorOperations
extends java.lang.Object
The class provides a way to manipulate 2 or more vectors. All the methods in the class are immutable, at no point any of the method will modify the given vector, it will simply return a new vector at the end of the calculation.
Since:
1.0.0
Author:
Mehul Katpara

      Returns:
      the inverse vector of a given vector.

      public static Vector addVector​(Vector v1, Vector v2)
      The method will add two vectors.
      Parameters:
      v1 - the base vector
      v2 - the vector to be added
      Returns:
      the resulting vector

    • addVectors

      public static Vector addVectors​(java.util.List<? extends Vector> vl)
      The method will add a list of vectors together and will return a resulting vector.
      Parameters:
      vl - the list of vectors
      Returns:
      the resulting vector after adding all

    • subtractVectors

      public static Vector subtractVectors​(java.util.List<? extends Vector> vl)
      The method will subtract a list of vectors from the first vector, and return a resulting vector.
      Parameters:
      vl - the list of vectors
      Returns:
      the resulting vector after subtracting all from the base vector

    • transposeDimensions

      public static Vector transposeDimensions​(Vector v, int d)
      The method will transpose vector to another dimension. If the given dimension is less then 2 or the same as the vector's dimension then the method will throw InvalidVectorDimension exception.
      Parameters:
      v - the vector
      d - dimension to be transposed
      Returns:
      the transposed vector
      Throws:
      InvalidVectorDimension - when the given dimension is less than 2 or the same as the given vector dimension

    • dotProduct

      public static double dotProduct​(Vector v1, Vector v2)
      The method will return a dot product of two vectors. If both vectors are on different dimensions then InvalidVectorDimension exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      v1 - the first vector
      v2 - the second vector
      Returns:
      the resulting dot product
      Throws:
      InvalidVectorDimension - when both products are on different dimensions.

    • crossProduct

      public static Vector crossProduct​(Vector v1, Vector v2)
      The method returns the cross product of two vectors. A cross product of two vectors if a new vector, this new vector is perpendicular to both vectors.

      Please note: if two vectors M and N is given then; M x N != N x M When you switch an order, the resulting vector would be in the opposite direction.

      If given vectors are not in 3 dimensions then, InvalidVectorDimension is thrown.

      Parameters:
      v1 - the first 3 dimensional vector
      v2 - the second 3 dimensional vector
      Returns:
      the cross product vector
      Throws:
      InvalidVectorDimension - when both vectors are in the third dimension.

    • angle

      public static double angle​(Vector v1, Vector v2, boolean d)
      The method returns an angle between two vectors. The method is capable of returning a result either in degrees of angle or in radian.
      Parameters:
      v1 - the first vector
      v2 - the second vector
      d - boolean for either in degrees or radian
      Returns:
      the angle
